p: The hepatitis C epidemic is similarly geographically diverse and mode of transmission differs substantially between regions. 11, 12, 13, 14 Globally, an estimated 52% of people who inject drugs (PWID) are hepatitis C antibody positive. 15 Lack of access to needle and syringe programmes (NSPs) and opioid antagonist treatment (OAT) result in unsafe injecting practices, which are the major route of transmission in high‐income countries. 15, 16 In low‐ and middle‐income countries, additional transmission occurs in healthcare settings through substandard infection control practices. 17
